footer.tagline: Pioneering architectural narratives shaped by context, craft, and human experience.

slide1.title: Sunrise Studio Composition
slide1.description: Daylight-bathed work islands bring the calm yet productive tempo of our new office into the spotlight.

slide2.title: Soft-Lit Welcome
slide2.description: The pairing of natural stone and gentle lighting turns the lobby into an inviting scene coloured with our warm tones.

slide3.title: Evening Façade
slide3.description: City-facing lights carry the refined evening posture of our office across the skyline.

vision.body2: Each folder covers atmosphere narratives from the opening scene to the night façade. Sketches and model photographs shared during preparation preserve the tone and accelerate the team's promotional steps.

hero.title: Behind the Studio
hero.body: Alpimimarlık is a small Izmir-based architecture studio. We fill the empty pockets in presentation booklets with in-house concept visuals so every deck carries a warm tone.

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.body1: Before meetings we pair rough sketches with scenes prepared in our studio. Each visual is supported by short notes describing the mood of the space.
approach.body2: This lets us present folders that clearly convey the office character even before the construction set is complete.

intro.title: Join Presentation-Focused Practice
intro.body: Alpimimarlık is a small, disciplined team managing concept presentations, model shoots, and pre-site communication. We are looking for curious teammates to strengthen the visual stories prepared in our Izmir studio.

rhythm.label: Cadence
rhythm.title: Workshop Tempo
rhythm.body: We spend four days together in the studio and one remote day for shared sketch sessions. Presentation files circulate within the team so revisions move fast.

mentoring.label: Mentoring
mentoring.title: Learning Together
mentoring.body: New teammates join one-on-one reviews with the founding partners. We develop every presentation template collaboratively.

atmosphere.label: Atmosphere
atmosphere.title: Warm Studio
atmosphere.body: A close-knit crew brings Izmir's rhythm into the studio. The model table, sound system, and photo corner are always ready.

roles.title: Roles We're Hiring
roles.description: Share your portfolio, a short motivation letter, and contact details for the roles below and we respond within a week.

presentationArchitect.title: Presentation Architect
presentationArchitect.body: You'll prepare plans, sections, and atmosphere boards for concept meetings and bring model photography into a catalogue language. Experience with Rhino, Enscape, and Adobe InDesign is expected.

bullets.two: • Ability to write detailed Turkish copy and short English summaries

visualDesigner.title: Visual Communication Designer
visualDesigner.body: We'll co-design posters, social layouts, and covers for launch campaigns. We're looking for someone who preserves our design voice while proposing fresh typography.

studioIntern.title: Studio Intern
studioIntern.body: During summer you will support sketch and model workflows and organise presentation folders before meetings. We'd like to see the narrative voice in your studio projects.

bullets.one: • Third or fourth year architecture student
bullets.two: • Availability for at least three studio days per week

application.title: Send Your Details
application.intro: Share your portfolio, résumé, and contact details through the form below. We review applications every week.

fields.messagePlaceholder: Tell us about your motivation and recent work...
fields.cvHelp: Upload a PDF up to 10 MB.

hero.title: Get in Touch
hero.body: Fill in the form to talk about our campaign-focused presentations or to request access to our archive. We schedule a quick starter session for teams preparing their first presentation.

studio.label: Studio
studio.hours: Meetings by appointment on weekdays between 10:00 and 18:00.

archive.label: Presentation Archive
archive.body: We create a private gallery link for sample visuals shared ahead of meetings. Please mention it in the form.

hero.title: Fresh files from the studio
hero.body: Whenever you add a project in the admin panel, its title, summary, and photo are published here automatically. The selected language matches the visitor preference, and “Multi-language” cards appear in both languages.

guide.title: How this list works
guide.body: Quick reminders so every editor knows what happens on the site:

items.one: Cards with a photo show a large hero both on the home page and in this view.
items.two: Picking the project type updates the badge and powers the filters on the Portfolio page.
items.three: If you delete and restore a project later, we keep its placement and media.
